description_txt: stated on January 29, 2010 in a Republican retreat in Baltimore:
quote_txt: Obama came into office "with a $1.3 trillion deficit before I had passed any law. ... We came in with $8 trillion worth of debt over the next decade."

description_txt: stated on January 29, 2010 in a Republican retreat in Baltimore:
quote_txt: "Mr. President, multiple times from your administration there have come statements that Republicans have no ideas and no solutions" on health care.

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in Associated Press' annual legislative meeting:
quote_txt: "I have had the challenge during this administration to suspend no less than 37 public officials in about 36 months."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: “Under (Rick Perry’s) watch as governor, over six million Texans have no health care coverage, including one million children, homeowners suffer from the highest insurance rates in the country, and college tuition has skyrocketed 136 percent.”

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in an interview on CNN:
quote_txt: The president's health care proposals will cause "most Americans to have their premiums increased, not decreased, and hundreds of millions of people lose their current insurance coverage."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in a blog post:
quote_txt: "President Obama's proposed 'spending freeze' will only reduce the $42 trillion in government spending proposed between 2011 and 2020 by little more than one-half of 1 percent."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Inequality in Texas is steadily getting worse, with very few rich people, a great many poor people, and fewer and fewer in the middle."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in a live-blog post during the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "President Obama pledged to go through the budget 'line by line,' but on his watch, non-defense spending has spiraled out of control, increasing by 67 percent in the last year alone."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in a live-blog post during the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "A majority of Americans still oppose this health care bill."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in the Republican response to the State of the Union:
quote_txt: "The amount of debt is on pace to double in five years and triple in 10. The federal debt is now over $100,000 per household."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in the Republican response to the State of the Union:
quote_txt: "Here in Virginia, we have the opportunity to become the first state on the East Coast to explore for and produce oil and natural gas offshore."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in a State of the Union speech:
quote_txt: "We cut taxes for 95 percent of working families."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Last week, the Supreme Court reversed a century of law that I believe will open the floodgates for special interests – including foreign corporations – to spend without limit in our elections."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in his State of the Union speech:
quote_txt: "At the beginning of the last decade ... America had a budget surplus of over $200 billion. By the time I took office, we had a one-year deficit of over $1 trillion and projected deficits of $8 trillion over the next decade."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in his State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "We've excluded lobbyists from policymaking jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in his State of the Union address:
quote_txt: The "pay-as-you-go law ... was a big reason why we had record surpluses in the 1990s."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in his State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Because of the steps we took, there are about 2 million Americans working right now who would otherwise be unemployed."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in a State of the Union speech:
quote_txt: "For the first time in history, my administration posts our White House visitors online."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2010 in a State of the Union speech:
quote_txt: On a government spending freeze.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a Republican gubernatorial debate:
quote_txt: U.S. Sen. Kay Bailey Hutchison “voted to continue Roe v. Wade.”

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: U.S. Sen. Kay Bailey Hutchison “has voted nine separate times to raise the national debt ceiling.”

description_txt: stated on January 22, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: "PWNED: House GOP Dominates Twitter, YouTube, Social Media in Congress."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a debate.:
quote_txt: "We have over 300 state agencies. Forty-five of those agencies are related to health care."

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2010 in an interview with NBC:
quote_txt: "Right now the Tea Party polls higher than the Republicans and the Democrats."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2010 in a floor speech in the House:
quote_txt: Democratic presidents "have been considerably more effective at creating private-sector jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2010 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "With a stroke of a pen, the (U.S. Supreme Court) decided to overrule the 100-year-old ban on corporate expenditures."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a Republican gubernatorial debate:
quote_txt: "We lowered the business tax from 4 percent down to 1 percent."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2010 in a fundraiser in Florida:
quote_txt: "As long as I have served . . . This is the first time every single solitary decision has required 60 senators."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2010 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Members of Congress passed a pay raise for themselves of $10,000 over two years even as they voted not to raise Social Security benefits for 2010 and 2011.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a debate.:
quote_txt: "The Texas Department of Transportation... misplaced a billion dollars."
